title: [6th Division march through Sydney and Melbourne]
other_title: Sixth Division march through Sydney and Melbourne

abstract: Footage of a march down St Kilda road, marking the return of the 6th Division to Australia.
description: Soldiers march past the Melbourne Town Hall, marking their return to Australia. The 6th Division was the first division formed for the Second AIF in the Second World War, after a decision was made in September 1939 to raise a 'special force' for overseas service. This Division fought in the campaigns in Libya, Greece, and the Aitape-Wewak region of New Guinea. Its individual brigades also fought on Crete, in Lebanon, along the Kokoda Trail, at the Japanese beachheads in Papua, and in the Wau-Salamaua region of New Guinea. It was commanded by Major General Thomas Blamey from October 1939 till 3 April 1940. The 2/1st Field Regiment AIF took part in Sydney march. Significant identities seen here are: Governor General Lord Gowrie; Sir Thomas A. Blamey; the then Premier of New South Wales,W J McKell KC; Minister for the Army, F.M. Forde; Rt Hon W. M. Hughes; Rt Hon P.C. Spencer KC; Lieutenant A.R. Cutler VC.
